entries.title: Faced with inflation, the French are cutting back on food shopping and relying on digital technology
entries.description: According to the BPCE Digital & Payments Barometer, households are prioritizing 'a more considered and select approach to their spending, adapting their consumer habits.'

entries.title: Film director Jafar Panahi released from Iranian prison after hunger strike
entries.description: The filmmaker was released on bail. He was arrested in July 2022, before the current anti-regime protests began.

entries.title: Hugo Meijer: 'We are witnessing a renegotiation of the international order'
entries.description: International security expert Hugo Meijer explains how Russia's war of aggression against Ukraine has upset the world order.

entries.title: EU countries agree on price cap for Russian fuel
entries.description: EU diplomats agreed on a cap of $100 for more expensive fuel such as diesel, and $45 per barrel on lower-quality products such as fuel oil and heating oil.

entries.title: Pope Francis exhorts South Sudanese leaders to implement peace accord
entries.description: 'Basta!' exclaimed the Pope, on his visit to the world's youngest country.

entries.title: France and Italy will send Ukraine MAMBA missile systems, say French officials
entries.description: The mobile surface-to-air missile system was jointly developped by the two countries.

entries.title: Over Lithuania, French Rafale fighters cross paths with Russian aircraft
entries.description: Twelve fighter jets sent by NATO countries take turns over the Baltic states to prevent any Russian incursion into their airspace.

entries.title: Morocco coach Walid Regragui: 'We want guys who are sure they want to give everything'
entries.description: Interviewed by radio station RMC, the coach looked back with sincerity and pragmatism on the Atlas Lions' journey at the World Cup, where they reached the semi-final.

entries.title: French Interior Minister Darmanin accused of 'historical revisionism' after slavery remarks
entries.description: A group of MPs from overseas territories criticized Gérald Darmanin after his remarks on slavery in the French Caribbean.

entries.title: Northern Ireland: British veteran receives first sentence for Troubles killing
entries.description: David Holden, who was found guilty of manslaughter during the civil war, could be the only person tried. Investigations into a dozen other cases involving veterans will likely not lead to trials due to an amnesty bill in the works.

entries.title: Ukraine made 'considerable efforts' toward membership, says EU
entries.description: Top EU officials were in Kyiv on Friday to meet with the Ukrainian president in a show of support. Zelensky called for more weapons to be delivered, as the EU announced it would unveil a new package of sanctions against Russia.

entries.title: Vladimir Putin brandishes the memory of German tanks at Stalingrad
entries.description: At the celebration of the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over the Nazis at the battle of Stalingrad, the Russian leader made a startling comparison with the delivery of Western tanks to Ukraine.

entries.title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Head organizer hopes Russian athletes won't get banned
entries.description: The president of the 2024 Paris Olympics organizing committee said he believes Russian and Belarusian athletes should not be punished for decisions outside of their control.

entries.title: Microsoft attributes 'Charlie Hebdo' hack to Iranian cyber unit
entries.description: The group of Iranian cyber operators Emennet Pasargad was identified as being behind a leak of personal information on subscribers to the French satirical magazine.

entries.title: Blinken postpones China trip following balloon discovery
entries.description: The US secretary of state was due to depart Washington for Beijing on Friday.

entries.title: Abortion in France: A pleasant surprise from the Sénat
entries.description: Against all expectations, France's Sénat, which is controlled by a right-wing majority, voted in favor of changing the Constitution to protect abortion rights.

entries.title: Paco Rabanne, visionary fashion designer, dies aged 88
entries.description: His bold choice of materials, his pioneering vision and his creative freedom influenced a whole generation of fashion designers.

entries.title: The long road to extending life of French nuclear reactors
entries.description: France's EDF seeks to amortize its 56 existing nuclear reactors as much as possible in view of possibly extending their lifespan to up to 80 years of age.

entries.title: EU Commission President von der Leyen looks ahead to a future with Ukraine
entries.description: 'We know that the future of our continent is being written here,' the president of the European Commission said on Thursday after a meeting with President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv – her fourth visit to the country.

entries.title: UK suspect admits trying to 'injure' Queen Elizabeth II with crossbow
entries.description: Jaswant Singh Chail pleaded guilty to three charges during a hearing in London on Friday.

entries.title: House Republicans oust Democrat Omar from foreign committee
entries.description: Democratic Representative Ilhan Omar was evicted from the House Foreign Affairs Committee on Thursday over comments deemed hostile to Israel.

entries.title: Germany authorizes manufacturers to send Leopard 1 tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: A German spokesperson said an export license had been issued for German Leopard 1s.

entries.title: French pension reform: The Rosies are back in their overalls to fight for gender equality
entries.description: Created in 2019 during Emmanuel Macron's first pension reform project, the mostly female troupe has become a fixture at protests. Their choreographed hits denounce the inequalities suffered by women.

entries.title: Article 122, the EU's 'emergency' trick to getting things done
entries.description: For the last three years, this mechanism, which allows bypassing the European Parliament, has enabled the Commission to pass legislative proposals such as the joint purchase of gas or Covid-19 vaccines in record time.

entries.title: 21 dead in attack in South Sudan on eve of Pope's visit
entries.description: Pope Francis is expected to arrive in the country on Friday for a 'piligrimage of peace.'

entries.title: 2024 Olympic torch relay to start in Marseille
entries.description: The torch will arrive in the port city from the spiritual home of the Olympics, Greece.

entries.title: France's small towns, the true front lines of the pension reform battle
entries.description: As in 2018-2019 during the Yellow Vests movement, small and mid-size French towns are highly mobilized against the pension reform. It could in the end make the final vote uncertain.

entries.title: Macron chooses to spare Netanyahu on his Paris visit
entries.description: The French president met with the Israeli PM at the Elysée on Thursday without publicly criticizing his attacks on Israel's Supreme Court or violence in the occupied West Bank.

entries.title: The disappearance of Brazil's maid's room
entries.description: Loaded with history and suffering, the small, dark room dedicated to domestic live-in workers, usually Black women, is disappearing.

entries.title: The quiet pizzaiolo established in France was in fact a notorious Italian mafioso
entries.description: Edgardo Greco aka Paolo Dimitrio, 63, was arrested this week by French and Italian investigators who had been after him for 16 years.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: 'Putin's offensive reveals Russia's limits and highlights the resilience of Ukraine and its EU allies'
entries.description: The Russian president betted on a winter of discontent to bring Ukraine to its knees, but Putin's attempt to sow discord in European public opinion has so far failed, writes Philippe Ricard.

entries.title: Artist Faith Ringgold's uncompromising depictions of America on display at first Paris retrospective
entries.description: At 92, the African-American artist, who has always fought for the recognition of African cultures and for women's freedom of expression, finally gets her first retrospective in France, at the Picasso Museum.

entries.title: While opposing pension reform, French left is forced to re-examine relationship to work
entries.description: Retirement, which is a consensual achievement for the majority of French people, has led left-wing leaders to reopen the thorny issue of the value of work. The answers vary, but the battle against the reform reveals common ground.

entries.title: Zelensky says Ukraine 'deserves' EU membership
entries.description: On Twitter, EU chief Usula von der Leyen said Ukraine was 'taking notable steps forward to meet our recommendations, while at the same time fighting an invasion.'

entries.title: Pierre de Maere, the flamboyant Belgian pop star on the rise
entries.description: Since the release of his debut album, 'Regarde-Moi' (Look at Me), the androgynously beautiful 21-year-old has taken the music world by storm.

entries.title: Moscow bids farewell to famous Sakharov Center
entries.description: A unique space of freedom in Russia that opened in the 1990s to perpetuate the legacy of physicist and Nobel Peace Prize winner Andrei Sakharov, the Center has been forced to close its doors.

entries.title: 'One economic model is dying, the next has not yet emerged and the transition will be costly.'
entries.description: Columnist Marie Charrel says that the happy globalization of the 1990s is well and truly over and the economic elite is haunted by doubt.

entries.title: Macron denounces Iran's nuclear program after meeting with Netanyahu
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is in Paris to seek a stronger European stance against Tehran.

entries.title: In Jordan, the trial of a human rights commissioner is emblematic of an authoritarian shift
entries.description: Alaedine Armouti, who criticized the 2022 constitutional amendments strengthening the power of King Abdullah, is being prosecuted for financial malfeasance.

entries.title: Inflation: Food prices in France rose nearly 14% in January
entries.description: Over the past year, the price of a typical shopping card of standard food products has risen nearly 16.3% with no end in sight.

entries.title: The Pentagon is tracking a Chinese spy baloon flying over US territory
entries.description: The balloon's presence comes amid slowly simmering tensions between the United State and China over Taiwan. US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin was in the Philippines this week to strengthen US defense cooperation.

entries.title: In South Korea, controversy over mandatory military service
entries.description: Though military service is generally accepted due to the North Korean threat, pressure from conscientious objectors led to the introduction of a three-year civilian service in 2020.
